page.title: 01Harbour Town Isle Whithorn
page.content: The surface of the land is broken knolly, tumulated appearance which characterizes much of Burrow Head an assemblage of hillocks, little hollows, scratched and freckled with protruding rocky extensively, scurvied with such briers and other coarse brushwood forming a miserable apology for absence of wood.Yet the ground which seems barren or moorish is carpeted with fertile soil and produces excellent herbage, crops of grain. Excepting the planted acres a small aggregate extent of little bogs, the whole area is in tillage. some of the bogs produce Turf-fuel, others contain beds of shell marl. The harbour is well sheltered safe and has internal capaciousiness and external advantages of position erected 175 years ago accommodating mainly fishing and sailing. Employment mainly being
